Welcome to citsampler’s documentation!¶

citsampler sampler¶

class src.sampler.constrainedMCMC(constraint, stepsize)¶

Defines a monte carlo sampler for constrained high-dimenisonal integration using rejection sampling

Parameters:
  • constraint – constraint class object defining the task
  • stepsize – float in [0,1], starting stepsize
proposalDistribution()¶

Proposal distribution for MCMC, generates new sample based on the current state and stepsize by combination with a random vector on the self.dim hypercube

step()¶

Take one step of rejection-sampling MCMC and update the resutling acceptance ratios

src.sampler.outputWriter(filepath, data)¶

Defines a monte carlo sampler for constrained high-dimenisonal integration using rejection sampling

Parameters:
  • filepath – string, path to output file
  • data – np array, data to write
src.sampler.rsMcmcPhase(constraint, targetSamples, numChains=5, maxIts=False, minIts=False, targetArLow=0.05, targetArHigh=0.25, stepModifier=1.05)¶

Perform multi-chain rejection-sampling MCMC on the provided constraint object

Parameters:
  • constraint – constraint class object defining the task
  • targetSamples – int, number of valid points to seek per chain
  • maxIts – int, maximum iterations per chain
  • minIts – int, minimum iterations per chain
  • targetArHigh – float in [0,1], maximum 100-step ar before step is increased
  • targetArLow – float in [0,1], minimum 100-step ar before step is reduced
  • stepModifier – float >1, ammount to modify stepsize by
Returns:

np.ndarray, valid points from all chains (my contain duplicates)
src.sampler.sampler(inputFile, outputFile, nResults)¶

Function to find nResults spanning points satisfying the constraints given in the inputFile, and write them to outputFile

Parameters:
  • inputFile – string, path to input file
  • outputFile – string, target output file
  • nResults – int, number of results to find
Returns:

int, outcome flag (0=normal, 1=error)

citsampler constraints¶

class src.constraints.Constraint(fname)¶

Constraints loaded from a file.

apply(x)¶

Apply the constraints to a vector, returning True only if all are satisfied

Parameters:x – list or array on which to evaluate the constraints
get_example()¶

Get the example feasible vector

get_ndim()¶

Get the dimension of the space on which the constraints are defined
